"Oh... Remus.." she said under her breath.

The book grew warm in her hands, and she dropped it back onto the bed. It bounced once and fell shut. Light played across the surface of the cover, brightening and shimmering. It came from within the book, rather than reflected light.

The shimmering light came into focus, forming letters on the cover.

"Messers. Moony, Wormtail, Padfoot and Prongs, congratulate you on your discovery."

Harriet ran her fingers over the letters, excitement filling her veins. A hiss came from her lips, as something caught her fingers like an insect sting, or the pricking of a thorn.

Instinctively, she snatched her finger back, a bead of blood sat on the cover of the book. It disappeared into the leather, drawing a pulse from the book, as it beat once like a heart.

Unbidden, the front cover snapped open and the pages riffled back and forth by an unseen, unfelt breeze. All the writing had vanished, each page was pristine, vacant of any words, pictures of anything.

The pages slowed, and stopped at the first blank page.

"Hello James."

The words appeared playfully in the cursive script.

Before Harriet could examine it further, each of the pages became awash with black, as the pages swept away their unblemished innocence and the contents appeared. She couldn't be sure, but, they looked to be different. Flicking through the book, she spotted four different styles of handwriting.

Her breath caught, as she realised she'd just discovered an artefact from the Marauders themselves. An achievement to rival their map.

She clutched it to her sumptuous bosom. Surely a breakthrough couldn't be far away now.

- - - - -

Lower in the castle, in the Slytherin dungeon common room, Daphne was discovering the price of fame. The level of attention, the jealousies, the curiosity.

Some of her housemates were still doubtful of her new abilities, assuming it was some type of trickery. Others suggesting it was a ruse, to cover her breakdown, and nudity in Transfigurations. A story to cover for an incompetent student. Her teeth ground helplessly, as tales of her nudity became a defiant streak... with some adding even more lewd and lurid details.

She couldn't get a moment's peace to settle any scores, against the rapidly growing number of enemies. Probably a good thing given how angry she felt.

It was one of the advantages of living in a magical castle, the shifting stairs and passageways tended to ensure you ended up where you needed to be, even when that wasn't where you wanted to be...

But she found a quiet room, and settled down there to gather her thoughts and plan her next move.

Harriet read the notes voraciously, eagerly absorbing every detail, every insight. The book was a personal treasure, an account of three friends trying to share... trying to ease the burden of another. She was sure, she knew enough to discover his animagus form, a dream quest that would reveal her true nature, an insight into her soul that was more intimate, more revealing even than a patronus. Thinking back over those she knew were animagi, she saw it clearly, Professor McGonagall's eternal curiosity, Sirius' loyalty....

Grinding her teeth, she cursed her father for not recognising the signs of Peter Pettigrew's weakness, his inevitable...

She let out a long, low sigh. James didn't have her 20:20 hindsight, was perhaps showing kindness, in not pressing his friend on the humble nature of his animal form.

A twinge of pain spiked through her spine. She leaped off the bed, looking around for danger. But the pain... the danger, wasn't physical. In her soul she knew the book had been used, reality had been re-written. Harriet darted to the full-length mirror her eyes looking for changes, as her hands raced over her body. She was sure, she'd know if the change affected her. But a mocking chuckle came from deep inside. She wasn't immune to the rules. Would she be aware of mental changes?

Tucking the Marauders' book away, she took a break, heading down to the Grand Hall. A nice meal, and she'd feel better.

The Gryffindor table was sparsely populated, but sitting down, a bowl of warm soup appeared in front of her. The thick vegetable broth refreshed her, the chunks of beef adding to the whorls of steam rising from the surface. She was half-way through the soup, when she looked around. Her eyes were drawn to Crabbe and Goyle, or rather to the stunning blonde sitting between them.

She looked uncomfortable in their presence, shrinking into herself as she tried to avoid the boys on both sides. A muffled choking laugh came, with a revelation, she was looking at a transformed Draco Malfoy. She had a bust that challenged Harriet's for sheer prominence and size.

She would have to speed up her own research, she couldn't give away that knowledge, if Daphne knew she was aware of the changes, that she was coming for the book, then she shuddered to think how vulnerable she was.

An unregistered animagus form, might just be the edge she needed to observe her. She wished she'd brought the map down with her. She was eager to confront her... Eager to retrieve the book... Eager to be back to her normal male self.

A leisurely trip through the greenhouses, allowed Harriet to get the herbs she needed for her dream quest. A memory intruded, of Professor Slughorn, and that night at Hagrid's cottage.

Her eyes watered, as she left the greenhouses behind. She had to stop herself from running up the stairs. Not just to avoid the eye-drawing jiggle, or the pain at her shoulders. But because, she knew that Harriet Potter's eagerness would be noticed. She was afraid that she'd talk in her sleep... in her trance, so she kept on climbing the stairs beyond the Gryffindor dorm.

She headed for Myrtle's bathroom, she'd already prepared the room. With a basic bed (well more a couple of thick blankets), and a portable cauldron. She had fond memories of it, of the polyjuice experiment. When the three friends meant to sneak into the Slytherin common room. Herself and Hermione disguised as Millicent Bullstrode and Pansy Parkinson, with Ron as Crabbe. Well, that was the plan, but Ron's potion was accidentally contaminated with a strand of Crookshanks' fur. She recalled too, the very un-Millicent eye-roll, that spoke volumes about Hermione's faith in Ron.

Her step faltered as she climbed, but she dismissed it as the treacherous nature of some of the staircases and corridors of the old, and frankly sometimes cranky castle.

Harriet crushed the leaves into the bubbling cauldron. A fresh aroma rose, the vapour dancing upwards. Thankfully, Myrtle wasn't in a talkative mood. Just happy to quietly observe. Scooping out a glass, she sniffed it, taking it deep into her lungs. A wave of dizziness threatened her, and she rocked unsteadily. It was only to be expected that it would induce sleep.

A quickly stifled giggle came from Myrtle, as she enjoyed the swaying intruder.

Harriet placed the cup beside her make-shift bed, and extinguished the flames heating the cauldron. She was sure her animagus form would be a deer, either a doe like her mother's patronus, or a stag like her fathers.

It tasted minty and sweet, as she swallowed it in a few swift gulps. She was already yawning, as she pulled the sheets into place forming an impromptu sleeping bag. Her eyes fluttered and closed, and she sank into a deep sleep.

- - - - -

Out of the darkness, she felt the Castle form, it loomed high above her, threatening to crush her. Looking around, her vision swam. But she could see she was outside. Beneath her feet, was the path to Hagrid's hut. The hut was lit from within, every brick glowing with an ethereal pale green light.

And beyond, was the forbidden forest and all it's denizens. Surely including deer.

The trees shimmered, each branch and trunk radiant with a haunting blue. Her feet were silent as she walked. In a blink, she was surrounded by trees. The sounds of the forest echoing around her, tempting her with their cries. A chill shuddered down, as she recalled the meeting with Voldemort, and unicorn.

As if summoned by the thought, her view changed again. The body of a dead unicorn lay on the ground, it's silver blood glistening, in the dappled moonlight. There was no sight or sound of Voldemort... or Quirrell. But she was filled with sadness, at the loss of such a beautiful creature.

From nowhere, a shadow leapt over her, and Harriet dropped to the ground. When she raised her head, she saw a centaur in front of her. It wasn't Firenze or Bane. Harriet knew, knew in her heart, that she'd discovered her animagus form. It was spectral and white, with burst of rainbow brightness bursting free in places.

She awake, with an sudden inhalation of breath, and shot bolt upright.

That gave Harriet an idea, while the Room of Requirement was unplottable, after it's discovery, the Chamber appeared on the map for Harriet. She assumed it had to fill in the details as the owner explored the castle.

It also helped her ignore the way that Gerry's gaze followed the slightest bounce and dance of her significant bust. Hermione mentioned something about mentioning stables, in 'Hogwarts: A History'. Harriet nervously swallowed. A new appreciation building already, of the centaur's plight. To be dismissed as a dumb animal like a horse, to be saddled, ridden, whipped and controlled.

When Gerry had a suggestion, he'd point to a place on the map, with one hand, while sliding his other arm around Harriet's waist. That just made her uncomfortably aware of her femininity, of his masculinity, his musky aroma, and the response that came unbidden from her own body. She felt hyper-aware of the girls shifting on her chest, and how close Gerry's hands were, while still not caressing her. She was alert to every movement, every slight shift, either towards her significant breasts. That always threatened to overflow the cups of her sturdy bra. Equally she felt it, when his hand slipped lower, towards the curve of her hips, or backwards to her plump, but very pleasing rear.

Nervously swallowing, she put her mind firmly back on track, as his finger pointed to a door on the map. It might be an abandoned classroom, or a spider infested cupboard. However, for the moment it was simply a door in the wall with nothing behind it.

Hermione was peaking in her bottomless bag, as she walked. Mentally checking, and re-checking in preparation for Harriet's animagus transformation. It was something with which Harriet was now familiar, before any new, unfamiliar or experimental magic. Hermione buried herself in research and preparation. Shyly, Ron was holding her hand, eager to see if this would work. Harriet read in his eyes, the desire to follow in the Marauder's footsteps, to be their own little secret collection of animagi.

Reaching the door, Harriet was hopeful. The door was actually a set of double doors, both wider and taller than she'd expected. It looked promising.

The door was stiff, as Harriet struggled with the handle. Grinding and complaining, it finally gave a crack and shifted, years of rust and neglect succumbing to her efforts.

They just concentrated on what was before them, taking in each inch they could see over the table. Harry loved the attention but the idea of basically serving as a referee in Ronni and Ginny's love feud sounded a bit much for the teenager. But then an idea came to him, and idea to settle this little feud once and for all.

Harry got up and practically sprinted back up to the Gryffindor boy's dormitory and pulled the ancient Hogwarts Rule Book out of his trunk. Making sure nobody was around Harry began to write.

If two or more witches proclaim their love for the same person, a contest shall be held called the Triwitch's Tournament. Witches or Wizards turned witches around the school will submit their names and top three candidates as determined by an unbiased judge will compete in three events for their beloved. The winner gets their love interest and the losers must acknowledge their defeat.

Looking at the text Harry was decently satisfied, he could always go back and edit it later.

"I am happy to announce the return of an ancient tradition that hasn't been held at Hogwarts for a generation. The TwiWitch Tournament. The Goblet of Lust has awoken and given us the name of a student who's affections will be competed over. Please come forth, Harry Potter.

Harry tried to feign surprise, but took his place at the front of the hall and enjoyed the whispers from the other house tables since for once he was actually asking for this. Harry looked at the ancient looking pewter black goblet with emeralds embedded in it that was spewing forth a red smoke. As Harry looked at the curious magical artifact Dumbledore continued, "If you wish to compete for the affections of Mr. Potter you will submit your name to the Goblet of Lust. You have 24 hours before the 3 witches shall compete in 3 different events. And to ensure there is none, or at least limited possibilities of pranking I will be putting a Ditzification Curse line around the goblet so if you do not cross the line with a heart of love for Mr. Potter you will suffer the consequences. Good luck to all the applicants. Let the preparations for the TriWitch Tournament BEGIN!"

He tracked back the blast pattern from the door and it lead to a pillar rather than the window. His fingers traced over the surface of the pillar. It crumbled beneath his touch, exactly where a blast of magic would have had to have ricocheted to hit the door. He looked from one side to the other, and this was clearly the point where things changed direction.

He ran his hand again over the pillar. It wasn't magical or a particularly strong type of stone.

The limestone crumbled as he touched it. Again he almost dismissed it, there was too much going on today to worry about one pillar in all this devastation both human and material. But a glimmer of something came from there.

He rubbed harder and the pillar continued to reveal something more.

It was a book, a small book. But not rough and ready, it was ornately decorated with an embossed Hogwarts crest on the cover.

Scrapping his fingernails he managed to get it out.

He flicked it open to the front page, wondering if it was some student project or what not.

But he caught his breath as he looked.

Written inside in bold but elegant capitals, "Hogwarts: The Rules"

Underneath that was the part that surprised Harry, were the names.

Godric Gryffindor, Salazar Slytherin, Rowena Ravenclaw and at the bottom, Helga Hufflepuff.

They looked genuine, to Harry's untrained eye. But every student knew their signatures.

He was about to show it Hermione. When the writing vanished into a puff of pale black smoke as the ink lifted off the page, then it disappeared in the light breeze from the window.

His call died in his throat, there was nothing to show Hermione anymore.
1511.title: They go in together.

choices: The damage from the battle starts to repair itself.
"What's that." Hermione asks, nodding towards the book.
15111.content:
Harry started to doubt his own eyes, as his fingers reached for the page. Disappearing ink was a trick even muggle could do.

That theory vanished like the previous names, as Harry's fingers caressed the length of the page. His own name appeared, and in his own hand-writing.

He felt a connection with the book, even as it sat in his open hand. It had bonded ... and he was the new keeper of 'The Rules', he wasn't sure what that meant.

But a voice whispered inside his mind.

'My previous owners have passed on.' it paused for effect. 'Now. You are the keeper of the rules. The sole keeper, a position of great responsibility.'

"Did you hear anything?" he asked Hermione not sure if this was dark magic.

"I'm talking to Myrtle...." she answered, as she took in his pale face, she continued, "What do you mean... hear what?"

'I'm the spirit of the school. Harry.' The book answered. 'I'm no dark magic artifact.' it assured him.

The tone softened, 'I'm imbued with the essence of the school's founders. So a part of me does come from Salazar Slytherin.'

"You are dark magic." Harry barked aloud.

Hermione looked around for some danger, her wand lit and ready to cast. Harry needed to keep his secret until he found out more.

"Sorry, I was just meaning all this damage." he added.

'Part of me comes from Godric Gryffindor, another part of me from Rowena Ravenclaw and the final element from Helga Hufflepuff. And you don't consider them ..... tainted'.

It sounded almost offended.

"I just wish Hogwarts wasn't so damaged.' he thought, as he recalled all the fond memories from exploring the castle in the previous years.

His thoughts formed as words on the open book.
15111.title: Before his eyes, Harry's name appears even ...

choices: Harry realises he's changed too...
Dumbledore arrives, and Harry faints in shock...
Ginny walks in.
151111.content:
Harry felt powerful forces swirling around him. The pages singed slightly at the edge as the magic went to work. However, when he looked over in fear to Hermione, she wasn't disturbed in the least.

In fact, she wasn't even moving. She sat rigid as a statue, half kneeling as she talked to Moaning Myrtle. Eerily the sight of a frozen ghost was creepier, lacking the indistinct haze at her edges.

The forces built and built, until they whirled about Harry as if he were the eye of a Hurricane. They even took on shape and colour, swirling in darkness. They intensified and soon even their blackness deepened. It shifted and became tears in the fabric or reality. A slashed window into a different Hogwarts.

The fleeting glimpses darted past Harry's eyes, barely allowed him to see it.

The pages fluttered angrily as the book tried to rip itself free from Harry's hands.

The tears started to join together, making larger gaps. Until it wasn't clear what was real and what was illusory.

Confusingly the peeks into the other world still showed Harry in the toilets. As they whipped around again, he looked to see Hermione was alright. Even as he did, it looked like she was safe. But there was a difference, she wasn't wearing her battle stained clothes.

It was also becoming clear that the new Hogwarts wasn't scarred and damaged from battle either.

He wanted to sob, as he didn't know what was going on. Without the wisdom of Hermione or the companionship of Ron it was just too scary.

A scream tore itself from Harry's throat, and suddenly it was over.

"Harry!" Hermione shrieked angrily. "There's no reason for all that noise."

Harry panted and calmed himself, looking around the room looked pristine. Just as he recalled on first seeing it when they started their experiment with polyjuice potion. A quick apologetic smile to Hermione and he tried to adjust.
151111.title: The damage from the battle starts to repair its...

choices: Harry decides to experiment with the book.
Harry needs to settle things with Draco.
Dumbledore rushes them off to Potions class.
1511112.content:
Harry was in shock, the devastation of the battle still firmly in his mind, as he fought for balance, both mental and physical. But the whole atmosphere had changed, he saw the look on Hermione's face. The only upsetting thing for her... the most upsetting thing for her this entire evening had been Harry's scream, as the universe shifted.

Dumbledore entered the toilets, "The Girls' Toilets again Harry...." a cheeky smile upon his face.

"The boy who slew Voldemort ... does he want to try being a girl."

Harry's mouth flapped silently as he tried to organise his thoughts. Was this really Dumbledore... What had happened to Hogwarts... What the hell was going on....

Even as he struggled to do anything but look like a gawping idiot....

His memory flashed....

Harry flinched... he knew what was coming... The bars of his crib held in his pudgy hands...

Tears welled in his eyes, as the sickening emerald flash screamed his mother's death.

His grip tightened as Voldemort blasted him, the pale light just reflected off his innocent body, and struck Voldemort. It raced around his body, crackling and sparkling, lighting him from head to toe, until he fell dead.

As Harry blinked the tears from his eyes, his sight returned and he was back in the present in the toilets. Looking in hope at Hogwart's greatest school master, his best friend and fellow student Hermione Granger.

The rule book throbbed hotly in his hands, as he tucked it away. The outline of the four house animals flared briefly on the cover before fading away.

Briefly he felt guilty about hiding this ... this most powerful of artifacts. It's creators ensured it's neutrality, and their stature it's strength. Harry wanted to race over and hug Dumbledore, to tell him how much he'd needed him ... his advice in recent years... But, he was the only one who recalled those years.

Harry promised himself that he would never use the book for such wide ranging changes...

The words of George and Fred, came unbidden to his mind as a guide .... I solemnly swear I am up to no good....
1511112.title: Dumbledore arrives, and Harry faints in shock...

choices: Harry was in potions, with his friends.
It was transfigurations, with Professor McGonagall.
The moon was full, and the Astronomy tower was well lit.
15111121.content:
He looked down at the book. Still unsure what he'd even done. The 'Rule', had seemed so simple. He was horrified, that he'd destroyed Voldemort entirely.

As if sensing Harry's fear, some words appeared on the page, written by a neat invisible hand.

"Tom Riddle and his unnatural Horcruxes have gone from history."

Snapping the book shut, afraid it was going to show him more. Harry's gaze darted guiltily between his friends, and Dumbledore.

The book had a last display of power, as each of the four house animals embossed on the cover gave a soft golden glow.

- - - -

It was days before Harry dared even take the book out. Everybody was still there. But nobody was mourning the absence of the Dark Lord, or even talking about his return.

As if performing some sort of acid test, he tried to talk with Draco Malfoy. That only served to confirm Harry's suspicions. Draco thought that he was being taunted, as if Harry was boasting. There was buried anger, but no sense that he was back, or even likely to come back.

Knowing the danger of the book, he absolutely refused to feel guilty for not telling Ron about the book. He was even handed, and refused to tell Hermione. She'd just want him to hand it in, or want to experiment on it. His own experience warned him against even the most cautious of experiments.

The hardest thing he found, was to explain his happiness to study potions. Severus Snape as head of Slytherin was still fond of arbitrary point scoring against Gryffindor.

It was a week after the restoration of Professor Dumbledore and Professor Snape, that his hand brushed against the embossed cover of the book, as he pulled out his text book.
15111121.title: Harry decides to experiment with the book.

As they walk Harry finds memories of his animagus form surfacing.
Rounding a corner, they find it's empty. Instantly Hermione shifts...
151111212.content:
The rule book caught, and was dragged out with Harry's text book. Just as he was about to thrust it back into his bag, a twinge of jealousy skewered him. Despite all his studies, he still felt annoyed that he couldn't use his transfiguring skills on himself. It was fun to turn a teabag into a toad. But to turn yourself into your spirit animal, to be an animagus, that was awfully tempting.

Although never explicitly explained, it was suggested that a Patronus was an external form of a wizard's spirit or soul. Harry was sure, that an animagus form was the same, perhaps even more so. Professor McGonagall's curiosity coming out as a cat. Rita Skeeter's penchant for spying and slyness shaping her beetle form. He thought too, of his father, and friends.

Despite his adventures at Hogwarts, he couldn't discuss it with either of his friends. As their memories were as completely gone, as the events. He tried to rationalise it away, as a reasonable price, to not be hunted by the Dark Lord. But it did mean, he was feeling a little bored, by the parallel memories he had of their time at school.

Quickly before doubts, and good reason could intervene. Harry slipped the Rule Book, out and scribbled down a sentence.

Harry Potter, Hermione Granger, and Ron Weasley, are unregistered animagi.

He didn't want to leave his friends without an incentive to join him. And the unregistered part gave it a frisson of excitement, of illegality. He was also eager not to get too excited, he stuffed the book back in his bag, to ensure he didn't add more rules.

With Hermione on one side, and Ron on the other, he was fidgeting in excitement, almost bursting to discover his animagus form. On either side, there was a coolness, neither of them were happy with the other. All Harry knew was it was about some argument in the library. His friends didn't even share his excitement. Their memories were familiar with the idea of the three of them as being animagi.

Finally the class was dismissed, and Harry almost dragged his friends away to a quiet corner of the castle.
151111212.title: It was transfigurations, with Professor McGonag...

choices: Ron and Hermione reach Hagrid's hut and restore themselves.
As Harry watches, the wolves race into the forest.
A movement in the forest caught Harry's attention.
1511112121.content:
Ron was loping down the track, pressing Harry to go faster. Hermione was moving apace with Ron, a graceful ground eating pace. She was normally more restrained, more measured even in her movement.

Harry was almost running to keep up. As one, their outlines shifted, as if they had collapsed forward. Soon matching tails were flagging in the air, wagging from side to side. Playfully, they mock fought for dominance, their mouths agape, before their attention shifted, and they sped away down the path, their paws kicking up tufts of grass and heather as they raced along.

Harry had noticed one thing before the wolves had moved too far away. It looked like Ron was a she-wolf, and Hermione a slightly bulkier male.

He knew the animagus spell was silent, in both directions. Simply focusing on that, he felt his body shift and transform. Momentarily he felt unbalanced, as if it was his turn to crash forward. Throwing his hands out to the side for balance, to break the impact... Just instinctively....

Then he was flapping, his wings lifting him higher and higher. A cry of joy, came out as an owlish shriek. He felt the wind caress his feathers, as he soared reading the breeze with his body. Down on the ground, the wolves were shrinking away, as he climbed. He had a magnificent view across the treetops of the forbidden forest.
1511112121.title: Ron wants to go visit Hagrid.

choices: Snape greets Harry with a huge, amused smile. "Welcome, Ms. Potter."
Hermione sighs in relief as the glamour fades, as they descend the stairs.
Harry spots Myrtle floating behind them...
15111123.content:
With a sly wink to Hermione, who was looking more confused by Harry's reaction than the existence of Dumbledore, living and breathing. She watched with amusement, as he cast a quick glamour over Harry.

Harry was oblivious to the spell, as his reflection changed in the bathroom mirror.

https://pbs.twimg.com/media/CeLa5YgUAAAP...

Harry's wild hair replaced by a flowing, leonine mane of curls. She felt a twinge of jealousy, as she followed her friend out of the toilets. Despite enjoying the joke, she hoped it faded before they reached the dungeon... and Professor Snape. She rather suspected the Potions Master didn't like Harry, even more than Gryffindors in general. He'd do something nasty, make the glamour a reality, or just make fun of him.

But, the speed of the glamour was impressive, as she tried to recall the details. She smiled absently, and nodded when Harry looked back to her.

For Harry it was a more confusing than amusing experience. The dizzying effect of experiencing that compressed time, and the re-writing of History. He was just glad Dumbledore was restored, and didn't want to press his luck too much. He ignored also the amused smile on Hermione's face, and the smirks from the other students he passed. As the boy who lived, he was used to being stared at. He knew that for everyone else Dumbledore had never died, and Voldemort was now completely dead. He shared Hermione's smile, even as his brain teased him with worries about the remaining Death-eaters, and other dark thoughts.
